definition: The application of biological and technical knowledge and capabilities to increase the productivity of fish stocks. It may be achieved by altering habitat attributes (e.g., habitat restoration) or by using fish culture techniques (e.g., hatcheries, spawning channels). In the context of the Wild Salmon Policy, only salmon originating from hatcheries and managed spawning channels will be considered enhanced.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2005). Canada's Policy for Conservation of Wild Pacific Salmon. Retrieved from https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/315577.pdf.
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2005). Canada's Policy for Conservation of Wild Pacific Salmon. Retrieved from https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/315577.pdf.

definition: A hatchery is a facility where eggs are hatched under artificial conditions.
The application of biological and technical knowledge and capabilities to increase the productivity of fish stocks originating from hatchery production.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2005). Canada's Policy for Conservation of Wild Pacific Salmon. Retrieved from https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/315577.pdf.
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2005). Canada's Policy for Conservation of Wild Pacific Salmon. Retrieved from https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/315577.pdf.

definition: Production of broodstock fish within the hatchery system. The production planning process considers scientific information, Indigenous knowledge, hatchery capacity, and risk assessments to determine the type and number of fish to produce in hatcheries, as well as where and when to release the fish.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2023). Production planning. Available at https://www.pac.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/sep-pmvs/hatcheries-ecloseries/production-eng.html [Accessed 09-10-2025].
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2023). Production planning. Available at https://www.pac.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/sep-pmvs/hatcheries-ecloseries/production-eng.html [Accessed 09-10-2025].

definition: Refers to broodstock fish that were born or reared in a hatchery and later selected for breeding purposes within the hatchery system.
definition_source: DFO. (2018). Review of genetically based targets for enhanced contributions to Canadian Pacific Chinook Salmon populations. DFO Can. Sci. Advis. Sec. Sci. Advis. Rep. 2018/001. (Erratum: October 2023)
definition_source_text: DFO. (2018). Review of genetically based targets for enhanced contributions to Canadian Pacific Chinook Salmon populations. DFO Can. Sci. Advis. Sec. Sci. Advis. Rep. 2018/001. (Erratum: October 2023)

definition: Individuals that are born and reared in the wild (natural environment) but are later collected and used in breeding programs.
definition_source: DFO. (2018). Review of genetically based targets for enhanced contributions to Canadian Pacific Chinook Salmon populations. DFO Can. Sci. Advis. Sec. Sci. Advis. Rep. 2018/001. (Erratum: October 2023)
definition_source_text: DFO. (2018). Review of genetically based targets for enhanced contributions to Canadian Pacific Chinook Salmon populations. DFO Can. Sci. Advis. Sec. Sci. Advis. Rep. 2018/001. (Erratum: October 2023)

definition: Ocean entry year (OEY) refers to the year in which salmon are released from the hatchery.
definition_source: Pacific Salmon Foundation. (2022). A Review of Hatchery Release Strategies. Available at https://www.marinescience.ca/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/2022PDF-ReleaseStrategiesReview-Newsletter-Web.pdf.
definition_source_text: Pacific Salmon Foundation. (2022). A Review of Hatchery Release Strategies. Available at https://www.marinescience.ca/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/2022PDF-ReleaseStrategiesReview-Newsletter-Web.pdf.
